name: baleen
content:

tissue found as several hanging pieces in the upper part of the mouth of some types of whale, that can be used to make a strong material that bends easily: Researchers analyzed DNA from 380 whales, some of it extracted from century-old baleen. The fishing line was caught in the whale's baleen - the series of plates used to filter ocean water for food. Synonym
whalebone
More examplesFewer examplesA whale's mouth contains plates of baleen through which it filters the water from the groups of small fish on which it feeds.When the whale feeds it takes into its mouth a great gulp of water, which it drives out again through the intervals of the horny plates of baleen.They then had to split the baleen, scrape it clean of all "gum," and then wash, polish, and dry it.
